intro: Gochnatia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved gochnatia, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged alternately along the stems, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Gochnatia parvifolia is often found in shrublands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
